title: The ‘Bachie’ Twitter Verdict Is In: Ciarran Makes Us Horny & Sock Gifts Absolutely Do Not
text:
Well, that was something.

Episode 5 involved a super awkward stand-up comedy challenge (Ciarran and Timm slayed though). Ciarran and Angie also had a cute rendezvous, there was that inevitable date where people hang from a building on harnesses (seriously, why do they keep doing this every bloody season?) and a whole drama about Ryan ~dogging~ ~the~ ~BOIZ~. Hulk-smash the link below for the full recap…

Now let’s dive straight into your tweets, which, once again, demonstrated either extremely high or worrying low libido levels – nothing in between.

Actually, fuck it, let’s just dive into the Ciarran thirst-tweets, given that 95% of this episode’s tweets were simply that. And hey, I ain’t judgin’ – Ciarran is repping for modern masculinity and turning it the fuck out.

CIARRAN showing us all that masculinity is a prison and you can still be desirable and glamourous and flirt…. He's a higher class if human. #BacheloretteAU pic.twitter.com/WelItXAN4j — мєαη тωιηк νιвєѕ (@lil_nazza) October 23, 2019

When @lil_nazza said “masculinity is a prison”, I felt that.

Doing an entire set in tribute to your own dong and everyone is into it #bacheloretteau pic.twitter.com/OBBNO9yJiM — Dame Kittness (@SoftKittyWarm) October 23, 2019

Their eventual date and smooch was so bloody cute, and it made some of us reflect on the ‘character’ journey Ciarran has gone through so far this season – a true underdog who absolutely won our hearts over.

Please raise your hands if you didn't think when this show started that you'd be rooting for Ciarren and falling in love with him Audience: #bacheloretteau pic.twitter.com/dV5jTKUpJd — Simone (@Sim_oneL) October 23, 2019

If Ciarran doesn't win this what's the point #BacheloretteAU — Jenna Guillaume (@JennaGuillaume) October 23, 2019

In stark contrast, everyone’s bored of Ryan and being super savage to him online.

Ugh Ryan is so boring. Bring back Ciarran on screen. #BacheloretteAU — Pauee (@paueesan) October 23, 2019

Ryan is super impressive, he even made Angie boring! #BacheloretteAU — Kayla Joiner (@_kayjoi) October 23, 2019

I mean, yes, I agree that Ryan isn’t over the top like Timm or Ciarran, but, in my humble opinion, I reckon it’d be too much for Ang if she paired up with someone who’s equally as comedic and energetic – that’d be a breeding ground for competition and toxicity. Maybe opposites do attract?

Also, if I hear the term “dogging the boys” come out of their mouths one more time, I’ll throw a dumbbell and protein shake through my television screen.

THIS IS NOT AMERICA'S NEXT BEST FRIEND #BacheloretteAU — taryn ʕง•ᴥ•ʔง (@thereafter) October 23, 2019

Now, back to Ciarran.

But it’s been like 10 minutes since we saw Ciarran #BacheloretteAU pic.twitter.com/dGpj6RNc1n — Chelsea McLaughlin (@chelseamnz) October 23, 2019

READ MORE There Are Whispers Getting About That A Handful Of 'Bachie' Blokes Are Paid Actors

My personal highlight of the episode was Jamie being all excited about having a gift for Ang, and then literally giving her a pair of rainbow socks. (SJKSKJSKSKSKS)

sOCKS OH MY GOD JAMIE STOP #BacheloretteAU — tay (@toziermeddows) October 23, 2019

Nothing says I love you like a present your grandmother disappoints you with on Christmas when your 8 years old #BacheloretteAU — Colonel Kickhead (@colonelkickhead) October 23, 2019

Long story short, 3 dudes went home who I’ve never seen before in my life, and next episode we meet the parents (yikes).

Until then, my fellow sock-squirmers.
description: Let's dive straight in to your tweets for episode 5 of The Bachelorette. Once again, you demonstrated either extremely high or worringly low libido levels.
